alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Wetzel (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 25 at 3:02AM EDT until August 25 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Monroe County in east central Ohio... Noble County in east central Ohio... Northwestern Wetzel County in northern West Virginia... Marshall County in northern West Virginia... * Until 330 AM EDT. * At 302 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of McConnelsville to near New Martinsville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... New Martinsville, Woodsfield, Caldwell, Paden City, Dudley, Sardis, Clarington, Summerfield, Belle Valley, Lewisville, Dexter City, Cameron, Antioch, Stafford, Graysville, Harriettsville, Hannibal, Rinard Mills, Laings, and Proctor. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 29. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
